content.raw:
This didn’t work for me in Bionic:

```
pip install -U colcon-common-extensions
Collecting colcon-common-extensions
  Using cached https://files.pythonhosted.org/packages/66/41/72f618236c6bac205abe253479100df09fddde237f3949f247e70b6e081c/colcon-common-extensions-0.2.0.tar.gz
Collecting colcon-cmake (from colcon-common-extensions)
  Using cached https://files.pythonhosted.org/packages/48/60/12007656f91c6a8d30480d3043a4510fd67dee0cd4753fb4f0e080a2e415/colcon-cmake-0.2.8.tar.gz
Collecting colcon-core (from colcon-common-extensions)
  Could not find a version that satisfies the requirement colcon-core (from colcon-common-extensions) (from versions: )
No matching distribution found for colcon-core (from colcon-common-extensions)
```

Looking at the `colcon` installation instructions:

```
On all non-Debian platforms the most common way of installation is the Python package manager pip. The following assumes that you are using a virtual environment with Python 3.5 or higher. If you want to install the packages globally it might be necessary to invoke pip3 instead of pip and require sudo.
```

I'm not using a virtual environment with Python 3.5 \(default is Python 2.7 in Bionic\). I installed `colcon` via apt with:

```
sudo apt install python3-colcon-common-extensions
```
content.html:
This didn’t work for me in Bionic:

pip install -U colcon-common-extensions
Collecting colcon-common-extensions
  Using cached https://files.pythonhosted.org/packages/66/41/72f618236c6bac205abe253479100df09fddde237f3949f247e70b6e081c/colcon-common-extensions-0.2.0.tar.gz
Collecting colcon-cmake (from colcon-common-extensions)
  Using cached https://files.pythonhosted.org/packages/48/60/12007656f91c6a8d30480d3043a4510fd67dee0cd4753fb4f0e080a2e415/colcon-cmake-0.2.8.tar.gz
Collecting colcon-core (from colcon-common-extensions)
  Could not find a version that satisfies the requirement colcon-core (from colcon-common-extensions) (from versions: )
No matching distribution found for colcon-core (from colcon-common-extensions)

Looking at the colcon installation instructions:

On all non-Debian platforms the most common way of installation is the Python package manager pip. The following assumes that you are using a virtual environment with Python 3.5 or higher. If you want to install the packages globally it might be necessary to invoke pip3 instead of pip and require sudo.

I'm not using a virtual environment with Python 3.5 (default is Python 2.7 in Bionic). I installed colcon via apt with:

sudo apt install python3-colcon-common-extensions
